intro: Arnica hardinae, commonly known as the hardy arnica, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has rough, hairy leaves and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Arnica hardinae is often used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory properties. It plays an important role in alpine ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
